JobTitle: Finance Program Cost Controls Analyst - Remote
JobFullDesc: About Us: At Raytheon Missiles & Defense, you have the opportunity to try new things and make a bigger difference across a broader end-to-end solution, a richer technology and product set, an expanded range of disciplines, a growing global footprint and a more diverse team of colleagues and customers.Job Summary: The Strategic Missile Defense Business Office has an immediate Program Cost Controls Analyst opportunity to provide support for SM-3 BLK IIA program efforts.  SM-3 BLK IIA is part of the Strategic Missile Defense Portfolio with yearly sales of approximately $540M per year with a secure and stable long term business forecast.  This program offers a unique opportunity to connect and collaborate with the Customer on a continuing basis.   The ideal candidate for this job will be an excellent communicator with an enthusiastic desire to learn and be challenged, the ability to work on a range of tasks, and the ability to connect with a variety of management levels and customer counterparts.  In addition, professional and effective communication skills are required due to the frequent interaction with program, product line and functional leadership.  This position will provide an opportunity to enhance your skills in PRISM, estimates at completion, variance analysis, and other metrics and tools used in support of production.Responsibilities to Anticipate: You will be responsible for management of both EVMS and LOE contracts, analysis of program performance, utilization of PRISM tools, establishing initial baseline for new awards, monthly forecasting, including tracking variances, interfacing with Cost Account Managers and the Team of Five, support of Government audits and ensuring compliance with EAC policies.You will work with bookings/backlog, providing inputs to Annual Operating Plan (AOP), 5 year Long Range Planning (LRP), maintenance of contract modifications, working capital and corporate ops presentation.  An advanced degree in a related field may be substituted for additional years of experience as follows: Master’s is equal to 2 years of experience.Qualifications You Must Have:Bachelor’s Degree Finance, Accounting, Economics, Mathematics or related5 years’ finance/accounting work experienceExperience interfacing and conducting business with various functional disciplines (Contracts, Operations, Engineering, Supply Chain) in program development and executionExperience with MS Office (Excel, Word and PowerPoint)Experience with SAP Business Systems (APEX, PRISM, BW) or similar toolsThe ability to obtain and maintain a US security clearance.  U.S. citizenship is required as only U.S citizens are eligible for a security clearanceQualifications We Value:Experience supporting contractual EVMS programsExperience with APEX, PRISM and Business WarehouseExperience working independently and with higher levels of managementAbility to effectively work in a challenging and fast paced environmentExperience preparing contractual IPMR requirements for contractual EVMS programsAbility to communicate effectively with peers, leadership and customerAnalytical, problem solving and decision-making skillsExperience training finance team members in tools and processesUnderstanding of AOP and Long Range Planning, program forecasting and metricsWhat We Offer:Whether you’re just starting out on your career journey or are an experienced professional, we offer a robust total rewards package that goes above and beyond with compensation; healthcare, wellness, retirement and work/life benefits; career development and recognition programs.
